category: THE BRIDGING GROUP: ALIGN AND CONNECT
subcategory: Limited Expertise in Identifying Issues through Analytics and Research Findings

content.text: This refers to the insufficient knowledge of analytics because of which organizations fail to understand the importance of using tools and analytics to measure the impact of DEI initiatives.
There is an absence of concrete tools for the analysis of DEI policies and their impact.
Organizations invest limited time and resources to examine the background of the insights gathered through data and do not distribute them among the appropriate decision-makers.
There is a lack of awareness and understanding of the importance of analytics among DEI champions; they may feel safe with their own strategies and comfort zones.
Organizations should focus on a minimal framework with clear measurements and output-oriented tools, to measure the impact of DEI effectively.
Organizations should work on making DEI a part of the annual audit financial reports to emphasize its relevance in organizations.
DEI practitioners can define actions, ratios and tools, measure progress with numerical measures, and review the actions taken and their impact on diversity and inclusion.
HR may focus on conducting employee engagement surveys with a detailed section for DEI to identify areas for improvement in the next couple of years.
Organizations can train more HR professionals to use data and analytics for use in DEI and other areas.
DEI champions can fulfill their role effectively by conducting awareness sessions and highlighting success stories of organizations that have used DEI initiatives to create a solid business impact.
